@JZRenalPath @UCLA_Pathology Oh I see. Hard to weigh on the clinical impact of one collapsing glom and UPCR 1-2 g/g in this case
@ausannier @JZRenalPath @UCLA_Pathology https://t.co/cVT288PoIa we had similar cases at the beginning of the pandemic
@JZRenalPath @UCLA_Pathology I've also seen TRIs in a transplant renal biopsy from a patient who recently had COVID-19.

@VelezNephHepato @UCLA_Pathology Also worth noting that the degree of proteinuria was relatively mild <2 g. Also, only 1 glomerulus with collapsing lesion. So my feeling is the oxalate is driving the AKI in this case.
@VelezNephHepato @UCLA_Pathology could be incidental. The degree of oxalosis in this case would also be expected to cause significant tubular injury.
@JZRenalPath @UCLA_Pathology I've had a biopsy showing extensive oxalate nephropathy in a patient who was self-medicating himself with high dose Vit C to "protect himself from COVID."

@JZRenalPath @UCLA_Pathology Maybe a vitamin C consumer?
https://t.co/tJBKntbOUB

text:
Fascinating data from the @ONS schools infection survey today, looking specifically at mental health and "long covid"

Reinforces previous reassuring data showing rarity of prolonged symptoms in children, especially those affecting daily life

1/
https://t.co/f1OD1lzPVP https://t.co/BwdwNXpQYN
comments:
@apsmunro ONLY.
This is the offensive word.
Say there's around 5 million primary school age pupils. 
"Only" 50,000 have had long COVID symptoms.
Would you like to lose your senses?
Mental health?
The ONS data do not state ONLY.
Try reporting data without spinning it.
See how that pans out. https://t.co/aaKMWSOhHz

@apsmunro These findings are very concerning.  Loss of sense of taste and smell is debilitating and can cause weight loss and malnutrition.  Long Covid is causing mental illness, cognitive and neurological impairment.  Why downplay these harms to our children?  Why not protect them?

@alisonpearsonSW @D_Anderson_UK @apsmunro @ONS Prolonged symptoms occur in small numbers but it is still likely most will resolve. This is an incidence study. Prevalence long term (12-18mo out) is still not known. Long Covid is not forever Covid.
@D_Anderson_UK @apsmunro @jajamjamejames @ONS And these % (I note you quote the lower one) are based on all children as the denominator - so will inevitably rise.

@D_Anderson_UK @apsmunro @jajamjamejames @ONS News can be better than expected without being “great”. 

To be honest I didn’t expect over 100,000 children to have had all of the long Covid symptoms already - given how much that can affect their education that’s much worse than I expected.
@alisonpearsonSW @apsmunro @jajamjamejames @ONS Why can’t you be pleased that Long Covid is 14 times less common than previously suggested. Isn’t that objectively great news?
@alisonpearsonSW @apsmunro @jajamjamejames @ONS Correction: I’m delighted that it is 1 in 100 and not 1 in 7.

@D_Anderson_UK @apsmunro @jajamjamejames @ONS We will just have to be delighted about different things then.
Me - not delighted that vulnerable under 12s have only just had one dose, even the lucky ones. And that there are zero mitigations in schools so even a small % will be many 1000s more.

@alisonpearsonSW @apsmunro @jajamjamejames @ONS Which is hundreds of thousands fewer than feared. That’s objectively good news. No, not the 100,000 before you twist my words, the fact that 100,000s of fewer people have Long Covid than was previously feared.

@alisonpearsonSW @apsmunro @jajamjamejames @ONS Hi Alison. That’s a straw man argument. I never said I was delighted about that. I never said it was over. I’m delighted that it is 1 in 7 and not 1 in 100. 

But you’re right Omicron has changed things. Teenagers have been largely vaccinated & vulnerable U12s offered a dose.

text: As we close out #BlackHistoryMonth2022, we honor @Raynard_W Washington, PhD, MPH. Dr. Washington came to Charlotte as @MeckCounty Deputy Health Director in March 2020 - just as COVID-19 made its way into our region. https://t.co/0hhEbaZeZI
comments: @CareRingNC @Raynard_W @MeckCounty Earned!!😊
@CareRingNC @MeckCounty Thank you @CareRingNC for this wonderful recognition!

"I’m most excited to work alongside an amazing team of public health professionals to make good health & well-being attainable for our neighbors. I often say neighborhoods are like gardens that grow people, & it's up to all of us to create ‘healthy’ growing environments for all.”

Dr. Washington was promoted to lead Mecklenburg County Public Health on 1/1/22, after the retirement of the prior Director, Gibbie Harris. 

“I’m honored to serve as the County’s Public Health Director, and humbled to be the first African-American appointed to this position...

Dr. Washington began his public health career working to reduce perinatal health disparities in the city of Pittsburgh with the Healthy Start program and has remained grounded in community-led work since that time.

In Philadelphia, he expanded their public health data systems, led the development & early implementation of the city’s violence prevention strategy, expanded access to primary care & championed the role of public health in local government with a focus on achieving health equity

He provided leadership to many aspects of our local COVID-19 response, while overseeing many of the operations of the department. Dr. Washington was previously the Chief Epidemiologist & Deputy Health Commissioner for the city of #Philadelphia and served at the @HHSGov.

Lex-Atlas: Covid-19 (@lexatlasc19), led by Prof @jeff_a_king & Dr @octavio_ferraz, is a global project mapping the legal responses to #COVID19, providing a neutral account of the principal developments 🌎

#PandemicAndBeyond https://t.co/6fmiOP2z1m
comments: @PandemicBeyond @lexatlasc19 @octavio_ferraz @ucl @KingsCollegeLon @ahrcpress @UCLLaws @KCL_Law @maxplancklaw @LeverhulmeTrust This whole project owes its existence to the fact that the @LeverhulmeTrust's Philip Leverhulme Prize gave me the space to react quickly to the pandemic while on leave they funded and turn research attention to it under the flexible terms of that prize. Thank you from all of us!

@PandemicBeyond @lexatlasc19 @octavio_ferraz @ucl @KingsCollegeLon @ahrcpress @UCLLaws @KCL_Law @maxplancklaw @LeverhulmeTrust Thanks colleagues, and esp for your excellent training!  We will shortly be publishing our preliminary datasets.

Read some of the ways different countries have responded to the pandemic on the @lexatlasc19 website:
https://t.co/XdzICXnlqH

The findings of the project will be used to assist #PolicyMakers in preparation for a future #pandemic, fashion ongoing responses to #Covid19, and to assist evaluation of state responses to Covid-19 💪

text: Being a young widow is hard, being a young Covid widow is even harder.  For almost 2 years I have had to deal with people & their cruel comments about me, my family, & my hero husband. @Jerri3dz @MarkedByCovid @WidowsYoung @JulieWallaceCT @DanRather @elliotkirschner @drjessigold https://t.co/5ApvnngKg9
comments: @readingswan I'm sorry for your loss. Grief is enough of a burden without being compounded by the callousness you've been subjected to.
@readingswan Anyone smell propaganda?

@readingswan I’m sorry for your loss.  The world goes on as if nothing happened, and in the meantime, I lost my father and live with the grief minute by minute.  I know you’re in pain and your struggles, and you’re not alone.

@readingswan @Jerri3dz @MarkedByCovid @WidowsYoung @JulieWallaceCT @DanRather @elliotkirschner @drjessigold I grieve for you and your daughter and the loss you have so unfairly endured. Your husband truly is a hero.

@readingswan @Jerri3dz @MarkedByCovid @WidowsYoung @JulieWallaceCT @DanRather @elliotkirschner @drjessigold Your husband was a hero. Condolences from an ordinary person in India for your loss. We live in a time of strife and anger especially online. Wishing for you that you can shake it off, like a duck and water

@readingswan While some have always jumped to blame-mode (to delude themselves that *it* couldn't happen to them or is not *their* fault) the garbage hurled on those facing Covid losses (death or disability) is especially horrific. I am so, so sorry.

@readingswan Your husband is truly a hero, one who stood and fought to save others lives while risking and tragically losing his. I’m deeply sorry for your loss and for unthinking people’s cruelty.  I don’t know you but your story resonates with me, sending love from my heart to yours ❤️
@readingswan @Jerri3dz @MarkedByCovid @WidowsYoung @JulieWallaceCT @DanRather @elliotkirschner @drjessigold I'm so sorry for everything you've gone through. My condolences and a heartfelt hug.

@readingswan @Jerri3dz @MarkedByCovid @WidowsYoung @JulieWallaceCT @DanRather @elliotkirschner @drjessigold I'm sorry kindness and compassion for others are becoming less and less common this day and age. Thank you for you and your family's strength through your grief. So sorry for your loss

@readingswan @Jerri3dz @MarkedByCovid @WidowsYoung @JulieWallaceCT @DanRather @elliotkirschner @drjessigold I am so sorry for your loss. People can be so cruel and insensitive. Your husband was a hero and deserves to be honored. His legacy will live on in your heart and in your daughters heart. Don't let what others say get you down. Big hug and stay strong! 🤗💙🤗
